New Records: Tyler Herro set a franchise record with his 70th consecutive game with at least one made three-pointer.
Key Match Events: Jaime Jaquez Jr. chipped in 20 points, including five crucial points in the final 1:03
Herro’s streak of games with at least one three-pointer reached 70, breaking Duncan Robinson’s franchise record of 69 games set in 2021

The Jazz had trimmed the Heat’s lead to 90-88 and successfully challenged a foul call on Walker Kessler. But after losing the ensuing jump ball, the Heat capitalized with a Jaquez three-pointer, giving Miami a five-point cushion with just over a minute to play.
Pre-Game Insights: Utah’s turnover woes continued, as they committed 17 giveaways—many of them unforced.
The Jazz remain the league’s worst team at protecting the ball, and their 17 turnovers on the night were costly.
Post-Match Reflections: Kevin Love missed the game for personal reasons, but his emotional leadership has reportedly galvanized the team during Butler’s absence.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Both teams struggled offensively throughout the game, combining for 31 turnovers and shooting below 40% from the field.
Despite the offensive woes, the Heat capitalized on transition opportunities, outscoring the Jazz 17-7 in fast-break points and making key hustle plays in crunch time.
